thread.title: Arsenal are ‘deliberately misleading’ fans with ‘fake’ attendances, blasts club’s Supporters’ Trust
thread.title_full: Arsenal are ‘deliberately misleading’ fans with ‘fake’ attendances, blasts club’s Supporters’ Trust

author: smorgan
title: Arsenal are ‘deliberately misleading’ fans with ‘fake’ attendances, blasts club’s Supporters’ Trust
text:
Comments ARSENAL have been accused of “deliberately misleading” fans with “fake” attendances by the club’s Supporters’ Trust. 
The official figure for Saturday’s 2-0 win over Hull was put at 59,692 – some 663 short of the Emirates capacity. EPA Arsenal Supporters’ Trust believe the actual attendance figure was 10,000 under what was stated against Hull on Saturday Rex Features 6 There were clearly a load of empty seats for the Hull game and the decision of many to stay away was labelled ‘disappointing’ by a club official 
However, the AST reckons there were as many as 10,000 empty seats and that the club are duping supporters by telling them the amount of tickets sold rather than fans in attendance. 
A group spokesperson told The Mirror : “They’re deliberately misleading people because they use the word attendance and it’s clearly not attendance. 
“What they’re giving you is tickets sold. They do know what the [real] attendance figure is and sometimes we’re able to get hold of it. 
“It’s obviously guess work using the naked eye but I could tell it was around 50,000 [against Hull] because I know what was recorded for previous games and could work out the equivalent. EPA There were certainly plenty of empty seats around Arsene Wenger EPA A section of unfilled seats can clearly be seen behind Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain Rex Features There was no denying the number of vacant seats at Saturday’s game Reuters Some supporters believe Arsene Wenger could be keeping fans away in their droves 
“The club ought to stop hiding behind a fake attendance and start addressing the real reasons.” 
And the AST believe Arsene Wenger is one of the reasons people are staying away. 
The spokesperson added: “There have been disappointing Arsenal results, some people are fed up with the team, some people are fed up with the manager. It’s a perennial problem.” Arsenal 2-0 Hull : Alexis Sanchez brace secures the points for Arsenal Related stories Mesy situation Mesut Ozil is under fire to improve from team-mates as squad factions think Arsene Wenger is too soft THAT OLD CHESTNUT Jack Wilshere suffers ANOTHER ankle problem in Bournemouth defeat to Man City… the NINTH of his career Bel of a fee Manchester United join Man City, Arsenal and Liverpool in race for £85million Torino striker Andrea Belotti STOP RIGHT THERE Manchester United ban residents from using footpaths around Carrington over 'spy' fears Off the Mark Mark Clattenburg is tempted by a move to the MLS or China because of referee scrutiny in Prem Donn a hat, Lukas Ex-Arsenal star Lukas Podolski shocks takeaway customers by working in a KEBAB SHOP on Saturday JESUS WEPT Manchester City ace Gabriel Jesus was substituted after just 14 minutes as he left the field in tears TV TIMES Benfica v Borussia Dortmund: What TV channel is it on and what is the latest team news? Devil's luck Cristiano Ronaldo almost signed for Juventus in 2002 if Marcelo Salas didn't reject a move to Portugal White Mart Lane Anthony Martial could be given Man Utd exit route as Spurs mull over stunning swoop for Frenchman Rash move? Marcus Rashford 'stalling over new Manchester United contract' as frustrations grow over lack of game time PREVIEW PSG v Barcelona: What time does the match kick-off, what TV channel is it on, and what is the latest team news? 
Arsenal's communications director Mark Gonnella admitted the number of no-shows for the Hull win was "disappointing". 
But he denied suggestions there were some 10,000 vacant seats. 
He said in response to the claims from the AST and fanzine The Gooner: "Always disappointing to see empty seats but your numbers are way out."
